person.defn: A named person entity must be the name of a person. Only first names, last names, and full names are considered named person entities. General reference to a person or people such as "actress", "Prime Minister of India" and "CEO of Google" are not named entities. A named person entity should not have any starting titles such as "President" or "Prime Minister".
person.name: person

demos.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin meets with Chinese leader Xi Jinping.
demos.label: CORRECT

demos.sentence: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau visits Indigenous communities.
demos.label: WRONG_SPAN

demos.sentence: Newly elected president pledges to address climate change.
demos.label: NA

demos.sentence: CEO of Amazon steps down from role.
demos.label: NA

location.defn: A named location entity must be the name of a location. Adjectives like "Chinese" and "Russian" are not named location entities.
location.name: location

demos.sentence: The Prime Minister of Japan meets with world leaders to discuss economic cooperation.
demos.label: CORRECT

demos.sentence: Australian wildfires destroy acres of land.
demos.label: NA

demos.sentence: German Chancellor Angela Merkel meets with French President Macron.
demos.label: NA

organization.defn: A named organization entity must be the name of an organization. Adjectives such as "Chinese" and "Russian" are not named organization entities. Viruses such as "COVID-19" are also not named organization entities.
organization.name: organization

demos.sentence: Apple unveils the latest iPhone model at a product launch event.
demos.label: CORRECT

demos.sentence: CEO of Tesla Elon Musk Denies Securities Fraud Allegations
demos.label: NA

demos.sentence: Japanese automaker Toyota recalls millions of vehicles.
demos.label: NA

demos.sentence: Pfizer announces new vaccine efficacy data against COVID-19 variants.
demos.label: NA
